context.introduction: Learn about the essential tools and equipment in a Japanese kitchen. Discover the importance of the rice paddle, knives, and traditional cookware.

sections.title: Shamoji: The Rice Paddle
sections.content: The shamoji is a wooden rice paddle used to mix and serve rice without crushing the grains.

sections.title: Japanese Knives
sections.content: Japanese knives are known for their sharpness and precision. Always wash them by hand and keep them dry.

sections.title: Cutting Boards
sections.content: Traditional Japanese cutting boards are made from wood, which is gentle on knife edges.

sections.title: Donabe: Clay Pot Cooking
sections.content: The donabe is a clay pot used for cooking rice and stews, providing even heat and subtle flavor.

sections.title: Tool Care Tips
listItems: Wash knives by hand, never in the dishwasher
Use wooden boards to protect knife edges
Season your donabe before first use
Keep all tools clean and dry
